conversation-text:
Becca Moody: We don't have to do what she says, you know.
Hank Moody: What who says?
Becca: Her. The Enemy.
Hank: Your mom is not the Enemy. She loves you. She wants what's best for you.
Becca: Mom doesn't understand, she never will. This is it, okay? I'm not just going to wake up one day and be like her. Six feet tall and beautiful.
Hank: You already are beautiful.
Becca: Chelsea is the only friend I've ever had. The only one who accepts me for who I really am.
Hank: That is not true.
Becca: It is. Do you know what it's like to have no one and nothing? How totally awful that feels?
Hank: Yes, I think I do, once upon a time, I felt like that. Now I have you.
Becca: Yet, somehow, I still have nothing.
conversation-title: The only friend I've ever had
